mnemonic: JANEIRO = 'ja-NAY-ro' - JANuary but with ZH sound!
grammar_notes: Masculine noun. 'Em janeiro' (in January). No capital letter in Portuguese.
cultural_note: New Year's in Portugal: fireworks over the Tagus lentils for luck!
example2_en: In January I start the diet.

cultural_note: Carnaval in February - Torres Vedras and Ovar have famous celebrations!
Spring arrives - time for 'queijadas de Sintra' (cheese tarts)!

grammar_notes: Associated with rain and Easter. 'Abril águas mil' = rainy.
cultural_note: 25 de Abril is Freedom Day - celebrating the 1974 Carnation Revolution!
example2_pt: Em abril não te descubras um fio.
example2_en: Don't shed a thread in April.

mnemonic: MAIO = MY-oh - MY favorite spring month!
grammar_notes: Five letters for month five. Beautiful weather.
cultural_note: 1 de Maio (May Day) is a public holiday - workers' day celebrations!
example2_en: In May there are popular festivals.

mnemonic: JUNHO = JUNE-yo with ZH sound - Santos Populares time!
cultural_note: Santos Populares in June - Lisbon celebrates St. Anthony with sardines!
example2_pt: Em junho há festas em Lisboa.
example2_en: In June there are festivals in Lisbon.

grammar_notes: 'Lh' sounds like 'ly' in million. Peak summer.
cultural_note: July is beach season - Portuguese flock to the Algarve!
example2_en: In July I go to the beach.

mnemonic: AGOSTO = AH-GOSH-to - the August vacation gosh!
grammar_notes: Traditional vacation month. Many businesses close.
cultural_note: August is 'férias' month - Lisbon empties as everyone heads to the beach!

mnemonic: SETEMBRO = sep-TEM-bro - back to school TEM-po!
grammar_notes: School year begins. Weather still warm.
cultural_note: 'Regresso às aulas' (back to school) - shopping for school supplies!
example2_en: In September I return to work.

mnemonic: OUTUBRO = oc-TOO-bro - like October with OO!
cultural_note: October is 'vindimas' (grape harvest) season - wine region celebrations!

mnemonic: NOVEMBRO = no-VEM-bro - NOVember with EM sound!
grammar_notes: São Martinho (St. Martin's Day) on Nov 11.
cultural_note: 11 de Novembro is 'São Martinho' - roasted chestnuts and new wine!

mnemonic: DEZEMBRO = de-ZEM-bro - DECember with ZEM sound!
cultural_note: Portuguese Christmas: Bacalhau on Dec 24 'consoada' dinner with family!
